instruction: Generate a SQLite query for the Chinook database.
input: List customers and their invoice totals.
output:
SELECT c.CustomerId, c.FirstName, c.LastName, SUM(i.Total) AS TotalSpent
FROM Customer c
JOIN Invoice i ON c.CustomerId = i.CustomerId
GROUP BY c.CustomerId;

instruction: Generate a SQLite query for the Chinook database.
input: Find the total sales per customer country.
output:
SELECT c.Country, SUM(i.Total) AS TotalSales
FROM Customer c
JOIN Invoice i ON c.CustomerId = i.CustomerId
GROUP BY c.Country
ORDER BY TotalSales DESC;

instruction: Generate a SQLite query for the Chinook database.
input: List tracks with their album and artist names.
output:
SELECT t.Name AS Track, al.Title AS Album, ar.Name AS Artist
FROM Track t
JOIN Album al ON t.AlbumId = al.AlbumId
JOIN Artist ar ON al.ArtistId = ar.ArtistId;

instruction: Generate a SQLite query for the Chinook database.
input: Count tracks per genre.
output:
SELECT g.Name, COUNT(*) AS TrackCount
FROM Track t
JOIN Genre g ON t.GenreId = g.GenreId
GROUP BY g.GenreId;

instruction: Generate a SQLite query for the Chinook database.
input: Find customers who spent more than the average customer spending.
output:
SELECT c.CustomerId, SUM(i.Total) AS Spending
FROM Customer c
JOIN Invoice i ON c.CustomerId = i.CustomerId
GROUP BY c.CustomerId
HAVING Spending > (
    SELECT AVG(customer_total)
    FROM (
        SELECT SUM(Total) AS customer_total
        FROM Invoice
        GROUP BY CustomerId
    )
);

instruction: Generate a SQLite query for the Chinook database.
input: Rank customers by spending within each country.
output:
SELECT *
FROM (
    SELECT c.CustomerId,
           c.Country,
           SUM(i.Total) AS Spending,
           RANK() OVER (PARTITION BY c.Country ORDER BY SUM(i.Total) DESC) AS rank
    FROM Customer c
    JOIN Invoice i ON c.CustomerId = i.CustomerId
    GROUP BY c.CustomerId
);

instruction: Generate a SQLite query for the Chinook database.
input: Find artists with more albums than the average artist.
output:
SELECT ar.Name, COUNT(al.AlbumId) AS AlbumCount
FROM Artist ar
JOIN Album al ON ar.ArtistId = al.ArtistId
GROUP BY ar.ArtistId
HAVING AlbumCount > (
    SELECT AVG(album_count)
    FROM (
        SELECT COUNT(*) AS album_count
        FROM Album
        GROUP BY ArtistId
    )
);
